introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• The Ig Nobel Prizes are a parody of the Nobel Prizes.
• They honor unusual or trivial achievements in scientific research.
• One study awarded an Ig Nobel found that opera music affects heart transplant patients’ recovery in surprising ways.
• Another honored project discovered that dung beetles can navigate by the Milky Way.
• The ceremony is intended to spur people’s interest in science by making them laugh, then think.
question: The student wants to underscore the Ig Nobel Prizes’ goal of sparking public curiosity. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: The Ig Nobel Prizes celebrate odd or entertaining studies, like how opera music affects heart transplant patients.
B: Established as a playful counterpart to the Nobel Prizes, the Ig Nobels aim to make people laugh at unusual scientific achievements and then inspire them to think more deeply about science.
C: Dung beetles’ ability to navigate by the Milky Way was recognized by an Ig Nobel Prize committee.
D: Some Ig Nobel Prize–winning research might be viewed as trivial but can still involve meticulous study.
explanation: Choice B highlights both the prizes’ comedic appeal and their deeper purpose of spurring interest in science, aligning with the student’s goal.
